data.name: Kalen Chock Presents: 3D Sketching 2.0
data.detailed_description:
Steam Video

This content is only available in an online streaming format. More information about streaming videos can be found in the Streaming Videos on Steam FAQ.


#label_about_the_series

3D packages can be a very effective tool in terms of creating thumbnail sketches for clients . In this video I will be using maya to demonstrate how use basic primitives to create environments ( though you can use any program that you like that has some kind of lighting in it ) From there we will take those basic block outs and paint over them! This lesson will come with 1 video hour of basic modeling in maya , 1 hour video showing how to paint over the 3D block out , and a 30 minute "sped up" video of myself painting over two blocks outs with no commentary.
data.about_the_game:
3D packages can be a very effective tool in terms of creating thumbnail sketches for clients .

In this video I will be using maya to demonstrate how use basic primitives to create environments ( though you can use any program that you like that has some kind of lighting in it )

From there we will take those basic block outs and paint over them!

This lesson will come with 1 video hour of basic modeling in maya , 1 hour video showing how to paint over the 3D block out , and a 30 minute "sped up" video of myself painting over two blocks outs with no commentary.
data.short_description: This is a tutorial on how to use 3D as an effective tool in thumbnails

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Network Bandwidth of 5Mbps for 540p, 3Mbps for 360p.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core I3+ or AMD equivalent recommended for HD 1080p playback
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Network Bandwidth of 12Mbps for 1080p or 8Mbps for 720p.
